page.title: 09POPULATION PATTERN
page.content: This is a{low density population {area.}Bartestree with over 800 people has the highest concentration but in general the area is marked by little housing and few people. Housing is characterised by the modern estates at Bartestree and Withington but there is a good stock of older housing with more character. Farm houses tend to be large and mainly older than 100 years. Many of the inhabitants do not work in the area, but commute by car to {Hereford}or{Ledbury. An unusual feature is the number of {Gypsies}who reside in the area all year, whose numbers are boosted in the late summer by more who come for the hop-picking.The Gypsies live in caravans or "temporary" huts.
